author: @siliconcanals
title: Portuguese startup Eneida secures €10.5M to optimise and control low voltage network
text:
Coimbra, Portugal-based Eneida, a company specialised in Neighbourhood Grid Intelligence for Zero Emission Neighbourhoods (ZEN), announced on Friday that it has secured €10.5M in a Series B funding round led by Junction Growth Investors
Other investors, including Santander Alternative Investments, Korys, HCapital, and the company’s Founders, also participated in the round.
The new funding will allow the Portuguese company to speed up its research and development efforts to further enhance its technology for grid operators and new energy players.
It will also help the company to expand its business and operational analytics platform to make ZEN accessible to everyone.
“We are delighted to welcome Junction and Santander as our new shareholders, securing the Series B financing round. This operation also reflects the confidence and support of our investors, led by Korys, in our strategic direction”, says Carlos Pina Teixeira, CEO at Eneida.
“This capital infusion will fuel our efforts to provide exceptional value to our customers, drive innovation, and expand our market reach to make ZEN a reality for everyone”, concludes Carlos.
Eneida: Reducing grid outages Led by Carlos Pina Teixeira, Eneida’ s solution addresses the challenges faced by grid operators and new energy players.
It provides clear situational awareness, detects and locates events and anomalies, and enables the optimisation and control of the low-voltage grid without requiring costly infrastructure upgrades.
The company says it allows for the rapid adoption of distributed assets such as solar panels, EV chargers, behind-the-meter batteries, and heat pumps, promoting economic efficiency and higher-quality energy solutions.
Eneida’s Operational Analytics platform — eneida DeepGrid, integrates smart sensor networks with data analytics and follows an open, modular, and interoperable architecture.
It supports the integration of third-party sensors and third-party applications.
Clients can deploy the entire solution or individual modules, tailoring it to their operational teams’ needs for optimal management of the low voltage network.
Currently, Eneida.io is operating across Europe, Africa, Australia, and New Zealand.
The investor Junction Growth Investors is a long-term, sustainable investment fund focused on non-listed European SMEs and scale-ups that play a crucial role in the energy transition.
“At Junction, we have identified grid-enhancing technologies as one of our core focus areas helping to de-bottleneck the energy transition. The International Energy Agency (IEA) states that grid investment needs to nearly double by 2030, with emphasis on digitalising and modernizing
distribution grids, in order to meet national renewable energy targets. Eneida fits perfectly into this grid enhancing technology: they offer proven solutions (hardware & software) to distribution grid operators (DSOs) to obtain a detailed real-time view complemented with active grid
management tools”, according to Dirk Dewals, Managing Partner.

author: @news18india
title: Pakistan Water Crisis Indus River: पाकिस्तान के पास सिर्फ 35 दिन का पानी बचा, बूंद-बूद के लिए तरसेगी राजधानी, डैम सूखने लगे - News18 हिंदी
text:
पाकिस्तान के लिए आ गई नई मुसीबत, अब सिर्फ 35 दिन का पानी बचा, बूंद-बूद के लिए तरसेगी शहबाज की राजधानी
News18Hindi
भारत द्वारा सिंधु जल समझौता निलंबित करने के बाद पाकिस्तान में जल संकट गहराने लगा है. खानपुर डैम में पानी तेजी से घट रहा है, जिससे इस्लामाबाद और रावलपिंडी में सिर्फ 35 दिन की पानी की आपूर्ति संभव है. बारिश नहीं हुई तो पीने और सिंचाई दोनों में भारी किल्लत होगी.
- पाकिस्तान में जल संकट, सिर्फ 35 दिन का पानी बचा
- इस्लामाबाद और रावलपिंडी में पानी की भारी किल्लत
- बारिश नहीं हुई तो पीने और सिंचाई में कमी होगी
इस्लामाबाद: भारत की ओर से सिंधु जल समझौता निलंबित करने का असर पाकिस्तान में साफ दिखने लगा है. रावलपिंडी और इस्लामाबाद में पानी का गंभीर संकट मंडरा रहा है. डॉन न्यूज की रिपोर्ट के मुताबिक खानपुर डैम में पानी का स्तर तेजी से घट रहा है और अधिकारियों के अनुसार जितना पानी बचा है उससे सिर्फ 35 दिनों तक ही लोगों की जरूरत पूरी हो सकती है. खानपुर डैम हरो नदी पर बना है. हरो नदी, सिंधु नदी की एक छोटी सहायक नदी है. अधिकारियों का कहना है कि अगले 10-15 दिन में अगर बारिश न हुई तो स्थिति और भी गंभीर हो जाएगी. खानपुर डैम के जलाशय में कई जगहों पर चट्टानें और टीले उभर आए हैं, खासकर मुख्य भंडारण स्थल और स्पिलवे के पास.
वाटर एंड पावर डेवलपमेंट अथॉरिटी (WAPDA) के एक अधिकारी ने बताया कि मंगलवार को डैम का जल स्तर 1,935 फीट (AMSL) था, जो कि डेड लेवल 1,910 फीट से केवल 25 फीट ऊपर है. उन्होंने कहा कि कम बारिश और लगातार सूखे के कारण जलग्रहण क्षेत्र के प्राकृतिक झरने सूख गए हैं. मंगलवार को डैम में पानी का प्रवाह (इनफ्लो) केवल 82 क्यूसेक था, जबकि बहाव (आउटफ्लो) 235 क्यूसेक प्रति दिन दर्ज किया गया. अधिकारी ने बताया कि वर्तमान में कैपिटल डेवलपमेंट अथॉरिटी (CDA) को 90 क्यूसेक पानी प्रतिदिन दिया जा रहा है, जबकि यूनिवर्सिटी ऑफ इंजीनियरिंग एंड टेक्नोलॉजी (UET) तक्षशिला सहित अन्य छोटे उपभोक्ताओं को 6.18 क्यूसेक पानी मिल रहा है.
सिंचाई का पानी रोका जाएगा
इसके अलावा, केपी (खैबर पख्तूनख्वा) और पंजाब के सिंचाई विभागों को क्रमशः 48 और 42 क्यूसेक पानी प्रतिदिन दिया जा रहा है. हालांकि, स्थिति को देखते हुए अगले हफ्ते से पंजाब और केपी को सिंचाई के लिए पानी की आपूर्ति बंद करने की योजना है. वाटर एंड सैनिटेशन एजेंसी (WASA) ने इस संकट से निपटने के लिए ‘वाटर कंट्रोल प्लान’ लागू किया है. इस योजना के तहत पानी की चोरी पर सख्त कार्रवाई, पानी के बिल न चुकाने वालों पर जुर्माना और गैर-जरूरी पानी के इस्तेमाल पर पाबंदी शामिल है. WASA के प्रबंध निदेशक मोहम्मद सलीम अशरफ ने बताया कि रावलपिंडी में प्रतिदिन 50 मिलियन गैलन पानी की मांग है, लेकिन आपूर्ति केवल 30 मिलियन गैलन है. इस तरह हर दिन 20 मिलियन गैलन पानी की कमी हो रही है.
पीने के पानी की होगी किल्लत
डॉन की रिपोर्ट के मुताबिक WASA ने मई के दूसरे हफ्ते से पानी की राशनिंग शुरू करने की योजना बनाई है. अगर जल्द बारिश नहीं हुई, तो डैम का जल स्तर और नीचे जा सकता है, जिससे रावलपिंडी और इस्लामाबाद में पीने के पानी की आपूर्ति पर भी असर पड़ेगा. यह बांध इस्लामाबाद से लगभग 40 किलोमीटर और हरिपुर से 15 किलोमीटर दूर है.

author: BioSpace
title: Possible New Hope for Metastatic Cancer Patients: Food and Drug Administration Grants Approval for Clinical Trials For Lamassu's Groundbreaking Cancer Treatment Protocol | BioSpace
text: Possible New Hope for Metastatic Cancer Patients: Food and Drug Administration Grants Approval for Clinical Trials For Lamassu's Groundbreaking Cancer Treatment Protocol | | CLEVELAND, April 11, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- More hope for successfully combating some of the deadliest cancers. Lamassu Biotech is proud to announce its pioneering effort to combat locally advanced metastatic p53 wild-type tumors has earned investigational new drug application (IND) approval from the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to proceed in initiate Phase 1/2a clinical trials. The trial will investigate novel therapy SA53-OS, a genetically targeted therapy that targets the MDM2 protein, a key regulator of the tumor suppressor p53 gene. By selectively activating p53, Lamassu aims to induce tumor cell death and inhibit growth, potentially providing a much-needed breakthrough in targeted cancer therapy. Lamassu has been working in collaboration with the Cleveland Clinic on this trial, led by Peter Anderson, MD, which seeks to develop a new cancer treatment for patients with limited therapeutic options. With functional p53 present in about half of all cancers, the potential impact of this treatment could be transformative in the fight against cancer. The IND approval by the FDA comes on the heels of Lamassu receiving one of the National Institutes of Health's largest available SBIR grant awards to help launch the clinical trial study for its innovative approach to cancer treatment. "This approval is the result of the vision and tenacity of our entire Lamassu team and our partners," said Dr. Gabi Hanna, CEO of Lamassu. "It is a critical step to move beyond conventional chemotherapy to targeted therapy to bring hope and healing to millions who suffer from stubborn cancers that don't respond to conventional treatments and to reduce the toxicity of cancer treatments. With SA53-OS patented in 69 countries, successful trials could make a significant impact on the global fight against cancer." "The initiation of this trial adds to Lamassu's record of accelerating drug development, delivering innovative therapies that can go from the laboratory to the bedside faster and with improved outcomes," said Dr. Hanna. ABOUT LAMASSU: MEDIA CONTACT View original content to download multimedia: SOURCE Lamassu Bio Inc.

author: news@irishmirror.ie (Zara Woodcock)
title: Molly-Mae Hague forced to make most of luxury Maldives holiday despite 'torrential rain'
text:
Molly-Mae Hague said she's 'having the best time' as she's forced to make the most of her rainy holiday in the Maldives.
The former
Love Island star and her fiancé Tommy Fury flew to the tropical destination with their daughter Bambi to celebrate the festive period. However, they left the rainy conditions of the UK only to be met with torrential rain on the gorgeous South Asian island.
Taking to her
READ MORE:
Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury put on united front as they share sweet snap with baby Bambi
She then shared a video from the hotel pool area to showcase the heavy rainfall. "Every. Single. Day," Molly-Mae added and posted a laughing face emoji.
Molly-Mae has been sharing glimpses into her
luxurious holiday with her fiancé and baby. The couple, who met during Love Island 2019, jet off on the luxurious trip on Boxing Day. They originally planned the trip just for the two of them but made a last-minute decision to bring their 11-month-old daughter Bambi with them so they could share her first New Year's Eve together.
In a recent YouTube video, the reality star admitted the idea of leaving their daughter at home with relatives was 'breaking their hearts'. The model and influencer explained: "To be completely honest and 100% real with you, originally it was meant to be just Tommy and me going for a romantic holiday and our present to each other for
Christmas.
"As it got closer and the holiday came around, we were both saying we didn’t feel comfortable with the idea of spending New Year’s away from Bambi. That was breaking both of our hearts."
The duo shared many posts about their holiday, including their first-class flight as well as their lavish resort as they enjoyed the island with a water villa at
The Ritz-Carlton on Fari Islands which comes with a private sun deck, infinity swimming pool, and steps that take them directly into the Indian Ocean.
The suite didn't come cheap either, with an eye-watering €2,700 per night price tag. A swanky goody bag includes a bottle of Whispering Angel wine, a fan and a wash bag with the hotel's luxury logo. Molly-Mae also shared a few gorgeous outfit ideas for the lavish dinners.
Follow Mirror Celebs on
 Snapchat , Instagram , Twitter , Facebook , YouTube and Threads .

author: Umer Jamshaid
title: After Helenes Destruction, North Carolina Starts To Rebuild - UrduPoint
text:
Umer Jamshaid Published October 04, 2024 | 08:20 AM
Swannanoa, (APP - UrduPoint / Pakistan Point News - 4th Oct, 2024) When Hurricane Helene roared over the mountains before dawn last week, it brought a maelstrom of water that rose to the mailbox of Shelby Holzhauser's little white house on the banks of the Swannanoa River.
To get food and water , for days she's had to don a backpack and trudge past mounds of debris left by the killer storm as it destroyed everything in its path.
"There's no power, no water ," Holzhauser said as her four-year-old son Carter clung to her legs.
Under sunny skies on Thursday, crews in the town of Swannanoa and all over in the Appalachian Mountains of North Carolina were fixing roads, pipes and electricity lines destroyed by the hurricane.
The death toll stood at more than 200 throughout several southeast states. North Carolina was the hardest hit, recording half of the fatalities.
"Us living on a hill, we thought we were going to be okay. But it got really close enough to where I had to get my son out of the house, and I was scared that we were going to get stuck," the 23-year-old preschool teacher said.
Nearly a week after the storm hit, and the hulks of ruined cars and other detritus have been cleared from the main roads. But life was far from normal.
To flush the toilet, Holzhauser has to use water from the river. As she spoke to AFP, her husband fired up a generator that his employer lent them so they can cook.
Elsewhere in town, men staffed a large stand with basic necessities at a shuttered gas station.
"We're all sticking together. Everybody's helping each other," said Holzhauser.
A lifetime resident of this mountain region, Holzhauser said life before Helene meant working all the time to earn money and get by, and she never really bonded with her neighbors.
But that has changed.
"I guess ever since the disaster happened, I was actually able to get close with my neighbors. They came down to check on us, make sure we had what we needed," she said.
Harrowing tales are everywhere and a neighbor named Vincent Floriani is no different. He stood outside a house he rents out, the floor of which was covered in six inches (15 centimeters) of muck.
As floodwaters nearly reached the ceiling of the house on the day of the storm , Floriani's tenant wriggled his way out and swam until someone saved him in a kayak.
Floriani could not find him for days and feared the worst, until the man called Wednesday from a hospital.
"It was the happiest phone call I ever had," he told AFP, his house now sporting an ugly brown line marking the water 's height -- at least seven feet (more than two meters).
"It is just utter devastation," said Floriani. "These houses have been here for 100 years, and there's never been a flood like this."

author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: Another Ukrainian attempt to breach the Russian border was thwarted
text:
Bryansk region governor Alexander Bogomaz said Russian forces prevented a Ukrainian sabotage and reconnaissance team from breaching the border in the western Russian region, about 240 kilometers (150 miles) from the site of the Ukrainian incursion in the neighboring Kursk region.
Bogomaz said that the border guard forces of the Federal Security Service and units of the Russian army managed to thwart the attack of a Ukrainian sabotage and reconnaissance team.
He added that the attempted incursion took place in Klimovo, which is adjacent to the Ukrainian Chernihiv region.
Bryansk is located northeast of the Kursk region, where a Ukrainian incursion has been ongoing since early August.
Ukraine stormed the Russian border in the Kursk region on August 6.
The Russian Defense Ministry said it had shot down 28 drones over Russian territory: 13 in the Volgograd region, seven in Rostov, four in Belgorod, two in Voronezh, and one each in Bryansk and Kursk.
A fire broke out at a military facility in the southern Russian region of Volgograd after a Ukrainian drone crashed on Thursday, Andrei Bocharov, governor of the region, said on the Telegram messaging app.
He added that there were no human casualties. He did not specify which facility was attacked, which he said targeted an area in the village of Marinovka, where there is an air force base.
Russia’s Federal Air Transport Agency (Rosaviatsya) said temporary restrictions were imposed on Thursday at Volgograd airport, suspending departures and arrivals.
#Ukrainian #attempt #breach #Russian #border #thwarted

author: VNExplorer
title: Pope Francis says Ukraine should consider negotiated end to war
text:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy smiles in Istanbul, Turkey, on March 8, 2024.
ROME — Pope Francis said in an interview that Ukraine, facing a possible defeat, should have the courage to negotiate an end to the war with Russia and not be ashamed to sit at the same table to carry out peace talks.
The pope made his appeal during an interview recorded last month with Swiss broadcaster RSI, which was partially released on Saturday.
“I think that the strongest one is the one who looks at the situation, thinks about the people and has the courage of the white flag, and negotiates,” Francis said, adding that talks should take place with the help of international powers.
Ukraine remains firm on not engaging directly with Russia on peace talks, and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said multiple times the initiative in peace negotiations must belong to the country which has been invaded.
Russia is gaining momentum on the battlefield in the war now in its third year and Ukraine is running low on ammunition. Meanwhile, some of Ukraine’s allies in the West are delicately raising the prospect of sending troops.
Vatican spokesman Matteo Bruni said Saturday that Francis picked up the “white flag” term that had been used by the interviewer. He issued a statement of clarification after the pope’s “white flag” comments sparked criticism that he was siding with Russia in the conflict.
Throughout the war, Francis has tried to maintain the Vatican’s traditional diplomatic neutrality, but that has often been accompanied by apparent sympathy with the Russian rationale for invading Ukraine, such as when he noted that NATO was “barking at Russia’s door” with its eastward expansion.
Francis said in the RSI interview that “the word negotiate is a courageous word.”
“When you see that you are defeated, that things are not going well, you have to have the courage to negotiate,” he said. “Negotiations are never a surrender.”
The pope also reminded people that some countries have offered to act as mediators in the conflict.
“Today, for example, in the war in Ukraine, there are many who want to mediate,” he said. “Turkey has offered itself for this. And others. Do not be ashamed to negotiate before things get worse.”
Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan — whose NATO-member country has sought to balance its close relations with both Ukraine and Russia — has offered during a visit Friday from Zelenskyy to host a peace summit between the two countries.

author: Elizabeth H. Escobar
title: ¿Quién es José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona, estudiante de medicina y papá de una niña que desapareció en Comalapa?
text: José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona desapareció en [Comalapa, Chiapas](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/estados/chiapas/elementos-de-sedena-guardia-nacional-y-fiscalia-de-chiapas-resguardan-a-la-poblacion-en-frontera-comalapa/), el pasado martes 4 de junio de 2024. La Fiscalía General del Estado ( [FGE) de Chiapas](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/estados/chiapas/fge-salva-a-nino-de-secuestro-detiene-a-4-en-sclc/) compartió el boletín de búsqueda del desaparecido, quien es estudiante de medicina y papá de una niña. Es por eso que te contamos todo lo que se sabe sobre ¿quién es José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona, estudiante de medicina y papá de una niña que desapareció en Comalapa? ¿Quién es José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona? José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona es estudiante de medicina en la Universidad del Sureste (UDS) de Comitán y papá de una niña. De acuerdo con su esposa, el hombre que desapareció en Comalapa el pasado martes “es una persona tranquila”. Además, José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona es originario de Frontera Comalapa, Chiapas y esta es su descripción física: [¿Quién es Sofía Yunes? La ex candidata en Veracruz que “ya no quiere hacer la chamba del gobierno”](/estados/veracruz/quien-es-sofia-yunes-la-ex-candidata-en-veracruz-que-ya-no-quiere-hacer-la-chamba-del-gobierno/) [¿Quién es Jorge Emilio González Martínez? El Niño Verde siempre ha estado involucrado en escándalos](/mexico/quien-es-jorge-emilio-gonzalez-martinez-el-nino-verde-siempre-ha-estado-involucrado-en-escandalos/) [¿Quién es Heriberto Grijalva Vázquez, candidato no registrado en Rayón, Sonora, que ganó las elecciones y quiere que le respeten el triunfo?](/estados/sonora/quien-es-heriberto-grijalva-vazquez-candidato-no-registrado-en-rayon-sonora-que-gano-las-elecciones-y-quiere-que-le-respeten-el-triunfo/) [¿Quién es Fidencio Canchola? Candidato a regidor en Guanajuato sufre atentado a balazos](/estados/quien-es-fidencio-canchola-candidato-a-regidor-en-guanajuato-sufre-atentado-a-balazos/) [¿Quién es Ifigenia Martínez? Claudia Sheinbaum votó por ella en las elecciones México 2024](/mexico/quien-es-ifigenia-martinez-claudia-sheinbaum-voto-por-ella-en-las-elecciones-mexico-2024/) - Tez blanca - Complexión mediana - 1.70 metros de estatura - Pesa 97 kg - Cabello negro y corto - Ojos grandes, cafés claros - Boca mediana - Tamaño de nariz grande y chata ¿Qué edad tiene José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona? La ficha de búsqueda de la FGE Chiapas indica que José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona nació el 12 de enero de 1992. Al momento de su desaparición en Comalapa, Chiapas, el estudiante de medicina tiene 32 años de edad. ¿Quién es la esposa de José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona? José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona está casado con Fernanda Mendiguchia Villatoro desde el 18 de mayo de 2019, de acuerdo con lo que indica su perfil de Facebook. El 24 de diciembre de 2021, cumplieron 10 años de relación, por lo que en este 2024, tienen 13 años juntos. [¿Quién era Dulce Alondra, la mujer que murió tratando de tomarse una selfie con la locomotora “The Empress 2816”? Lo que se sabe de ella](/estados/quien-era-dulce-alondra-la-mujer-que-murio-tratando-de-tomarse-una-selfie-con-la-locomotora-the-empress-2816-lo-que-se-sabe-de-ella/) [Matrimonio desaparecido en Poza Rica: Hallan cuerpos de Emma Lucia Bandala Herrera y Santiago Rodríguez](/estados/veracruz/matrimonio-desaparecido-en-poza-rica-hallan-cuerpos-de-emma-lucia-bandala-herrera-y-santiago-rodriguez/) [El video de la mujer que murió al hacerse una selfie con la locomotora “The Empress 2816″ en Nopala de Villagrán, Hidalgo](/estados/el-video-de-la-mujer-que-murio-al-hacerse-una-selfie-con-la-locomotora-the-empress-2816-en-nopala-de-villagran-hidalgo/) Fue la esposa de José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona quien alertó a las autoridades sobre la desaparición del estudiante de medicina y papá de una niña. ¿Qué signo zodiacal es José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona? Debido a que José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona nació el 12 de enero, le corresponde el signo zodiacal de Capricornio. Capricornio es un signo zodiacal cardinal del elemento tierra, por lo que las personas nacidas bajo este signo del zodiaco suelen ser constantes, sólidas y apacibles. ¿Cuántos hijos tiene José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona? José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona es papá de una niña que nació a finales de 2020 o principios de 2021. En la actualidad, la hija del estudiante de medicina que desapareció en Comalapa tiene 3 años de edad. ¿Qué estudió José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona? José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona es estudiante del sexto semestre de Medicina Humana en la Universidad del Sureste (UDS) de Comitán. La ficha de búsqueda refiere que tiene la universidad trunca. ¿En qué ha trabajado José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona? El perfil de Linkedin de José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona indica que ha trabajado como jefe de equipo en IMMS, aunque se especifica que fue un contrato para realizar prácticas profesionales. José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona, estudiante de medicina y papá de una niña que desapareció en Comalapa José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona, estudiante de medicina y papá de una niña, desapareció en Comalapa el pasado martes 4 de junio de 2024. La FGE Chiapas señala que esto fue alertado a las autoridades por su esposa, quien indicó que aproximadamente a las 9:00 horas de ese día, fue la última vez que lo vieron. Los hechos ocurrieron en la colonia San Gregorio Chamic, que pertenece al municipio de Frontera Comalapa, Chiapas, por lo que se desconoce su paradero desde entonces. Como señas particulares, José Alberto Cifuentes Cardona tiene tatuajes en la espalda: - De lado izquierdo, la leyenda “Marcos” - De lado derecho, la leyenda “Leticia” - En el centro de la espalda, la figura de un viejito y un niño sosteniendo un globo rojo y debajo la leyenda “los abuelos que crían a sus nietos dejan huellas en el alma”. También se indica que el estudiante de medicina y papá de una niña que desapareció en Comalapa, iba vestido con una playera rayada de color blanco con azul y celeste, pantalón de mezclilla de color celeste, zapatos color negro y mochila negra.

author: NY Weekly Staff
title: How Data Science is Transforming Healthcare: A Deep Dive
text:
There are applications for data science everywhere in our lives. Data science is necessary for every industry in the world, including IT, entertainment, healthcare, and many more, to become more productive and generate higher returns on investment. You may be asking now how Data Science is being used in Healthcare. Keep reading the article to learn how Data Science is changing this industry.
With the advent of low-cost internet and increased processing power, every business is now data-hungry, offering customers a digital life unlike anything before. A few terabytes of data are produced daily by users today.
For deeper insights into the intersection of data science and healthcare, visit
https://www.johnsnowlabs.com/healthcare-llm/. John Snow Labs has a wealth of experience using linguistic pattern analysis to extract data from various information sources, including text, audio, and visual.
Why is data science used in healthcare?
Like other fields, the healthcare industry has immense amounts of data about patients, medical histories, and individuals’ health information. These data could include blood pressure, heart level, sugar level, stress level, and so forth.
The problem is that healthcare has traditionally been passive. That is, we have never been able to manage or reduce diseases on a wide scale because we lack centralized data to evaluate and develop insights that could assist the healthcare system in saving lives.
It gave rise to the idea of applying data science to the healthcare industry to digitize all of these data points and compile them into a health map for each patient, which would enable them to get the best treatment possible.
Without this ability, it will be far too late to detect life-threatening disorders in individuals.
Thanks to data science and machine learning, doctors can now get real-time information on a patient’s health status using wearable technology, such as a smartwatch that continuously tracks a patient’s vital signs.
The advantages of data science for medical systems
We are now aware of the problems with healthcare systems; thanks to data science’s capability, healthcare systems are now data-driven and effective. Now, let’s examine how applying data science has benefited the healthcare industry.
- It helps to shorten the patient’s wait time.
- It aided in providing patients with appropriate care on time.
- It contributed to the healthcare system’s workflow being more efficient.
- It made emergencies more straightforward to handle.
- It reduced the likelihood of patient failure while receiving treatment.
By using AI-enabled devices to analyze data, it may be possible to detect diseases early on and significantly reduce healthcare costs. This would also make it easier for healthcare insurance companies to monitor these parameters and create more customized, customer-friendly policies.
What role do Data Scientists play in the Healthcare sector?
Healthcare features and policies are evolving at an increasingly rapid pace. The overall application of data science in the healthcare system shows data scientists as a crucial and essential component.
When working with data, data scientists find patterns and insights that may be used to build prediction models.
Here, we’ll quickly review the key responsibilities of Data Science specialists to help you understand how they fit into the overall healthcare system.
- Gather and examine patient information, hospital requirements, and other details.
- Organize and classify data so that medical practitioners can use it more easily.
- Utilize data analytics to create predictive models by applying various algorithms to raw data.
To sum up, data scientists employed by the healthcare system support medical staff in providing high-quality and efficient patient care.
Published by: Martin De Juan

author: Women We Admire
title: Women We Admire is Pleased to Announce Top Women Leaders of 2024
text: NEW YORK, March 14, 2024 /PRNewswire-PRWeb/ -- Women We Admire is pleased to announce Top Women Leaders of 2024. In 2023, women occupied 32.2% of senior leadership roles. These include C-suite and director-level positions. Even though there is a long way to go before women and men have equal representation in executive roles, there is no lack of accomplished, seasoned women leaders to celebrate. Many of these women leaders have served some of the top brands in the world. Honoree Katie Clark is currently the Senior Vice President and Chief Communications Officer for Hormel Foods. She's held previous leadership roles at Mattress Firm, PepsiCo, Tropicana, and Quaker Oats. Additionally, we recognize the career of Leslie Snavely, the President at CHG Healthcare, the largest physician staffing company in the country. In this role, she led the development of CHG's strategic plan and the acquisition of two tech companies. Finally, we acknowledge the amazing work of honoree Addie Teeters, the Vice President of Marketing Communications for the Special Olympics Wisconsin. After an extensive career in marketing communications, Teeters accepted this impactful leadership role in 2023. Please join us in celebrating the accomplishments of these Top Women Leaders of 2024. Staci Thompson (Bassett Healthcare Network), Chandra Clark (Corey C. Griffin Foundation), Pooja Vyas (BJC Healthcare - Christian Hospital), Laura Ipsen (Ellucian), Latanya McNeal (Palm Beach State College), Nada Sitto Kasyouhanan (MWHS Design), Leslie Snavely (CHG Healthcare), Shelley Zumwalt (State of Oklahoma), Addie Teeters (Special Olympics Wisconsin), Uzma Akhtar (The Trade Desk), Nicole Bernardo (Northwestern Mutual Boston), Kelly Munson (Aetna), Katie Clark (Hormel Foods). To view the full list, visit [https://thewomenweadmire.com/2024/03/12/the-top-women-leaders-of-2024/](https://c212.net/c/link/?t=0&l=en&o=4113873-1&h=1193794958&u=https%3A%2F%2Fthewomenweadmire.com%2F2024%2F03%2F12%2Fthe-top-women-leaders-of-2024%2F&a=https%3A%2F%2Fthewomenweadmire.com%2F2024%2F03%2F12%2Fthe-top-women-leaders-of-2024%2F) About Women We Admire Women We Admire provides news and information on today's women leaders in business, entertainment, sports, motherhood, medicine, law, and many other fields. We cover a broad range of topics and areas of interest aimed at recognizing the achievements of exceptional women while inspiring others to aim high and continue their journey towards reaching their full potential. Women We Admire and its affiliates circulate its content to over 32,000 individuals and businesses. Media Contact Editor, Women We Admire, 1 609-365-7014, [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#9df8f9f4e9f2efdde9f5f8eaf2f0f8f3eaf8fcf9f0f4eff8b3fef2f0), [https://thewomenweadmire.com/](https://c212.net/c/link/?t=0&l=en&o=4113873-1&h=1999380352&u=https%3A%2F%2Fthewomenweadmire.com%2F&a=https%3A%2F%2Fthewomenweadmire.com%2F) SOURCE Women We Admire
